intro: Pisonia macranthocarpa, commonly known as the large-flowered pisonia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale pink to white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, which are often dispersed by wind.
